clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of CDI-31244: A Novel NNI in HV and HCV Infected Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ia/Ib Study Assessing Single and Multiple Doses of CDI-31244: A Non-Nucleoside Inhibitor in Healthy and Hepatitis C Virus-Infected Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a First in Human study of orally administered CDI-31244, a non-nucleoside inhibitor (NNI) in healthy volunteers and HCV infected individuals

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a single center, double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized, single ascending oral dose and multiple oral dose design, incorporating fed/fasted comparisons.
The study will include two groups: Group A - single ascending dose (SAD) including a food effect cohort, and multiple dose (MD) in healthy volunteers (HV), and Group B MD in Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infected individuals divided in two parts.
Five single-dose cohort are planned. For the five single-dose cohorts, a sentinel group of 2 subjects will be dosed at least one day prior to enrolling remaining subjects.
Six multiple-dose cohorts are planned. Three multiple dose cohorts in healthy volunteers and three cohorts in HCV-infected individuals.
The dosing of Group B will be conducted following safety and pharmacokinetic (PK) review of Group A. The dosing of Group B, Part 2 will be conducted only if Part 1 shows acceptable safety and efficacy results.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of treatment emergent adverse events (AE)
primary_outcome.description: The safety and the tolerability of single and multiple oral doses of CDI-31244 through number of AEs observed in HV and HCV infected subjects

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure plasma levels of CDI-31244 after SD
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma levels of CDI-31244 in the the single dose HV cohorts

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure plasma levels of CDI-31244 after SD in fasted and fed conditions
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of food on the plasma levels of CDI-31244 in the single dose HV cohorts

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure plasma levels of CDI-31244 after MD
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma levels of CDI-31244 in the multiple dose HV and HCV infected cohorts

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure HCV viral load through the RNA quantitative test
secondary_outcome.description: The clinical efficacy of CDI-31244 in HCV-infected subjects as measured by the maximal change in antiviral activity through changes in the HCV RNA load

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure HCV mutation through genotyping at baseline and after CDI-31244 dosing
secondary_outcome.description: The possible emergence of hepatitis C virus resistance mutation in HCV infected subjects
